definition: to win a bid/to win a trophy in a contest/(jokingly) to get an STD
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units

sentences.english: Guess what, Gilly ? I won both bids.
sentences.chinese: 你猜怎樣着，吉莉？我兩個拍賣都得標了。

sentences.english: B: You’re perfectly welcome to inspect the winning bid .
sentences.chinese: 我們很歡迎你來查閱得標者。
請通知我爲何我們沒有得標好嗎？

sentences.english: Both of the candidates are close together in the polls .
sentences.chinese: 兩位候選人在民意測驗中的得標相當接近。

sentences.english: You're perfectly welcome to inspect the winning bid.
sentences.chinese: 我們很歡迎你來查閱得標者的報價。

sentences.english: You're perfectly welcome to inspect the winning bid .
sentences.chinese: 很歡迎你來查閱得標者。

definition: war of words
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
When you enter a village, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
(spoken) Chinese language
rich and imposing/rich and overbearing
unable to help however much one would like to (idiom); Although we sympathize, there is no way to help you./My hands are tied.
an extra (in a movie)
to talk from one's personal experience/to use oneself as an example
layman
concerted action/to collude (in dishonesty)
to announce/to read (the news)
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
to beat down the price/to haggle/to slash one's prices
to recommend oneself (for a job)
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
